contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox AM | honorific-prefix = | name = The Baroness Doocey [[OBE]] | honorific-suffix = | image = Dee_Doocey_(Baroness_Doocey)_-_2012.jpg | caption = | constituency_AM = the [[Liberal Democrats]] (London-wide) | assembly = London | term_start = 10 June 2004 | term_end = 3 May 2012 | majority = | predecessor = | successor = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1948|5|2|df=yes}} | birth_place = Drumcondra, Dublin | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[United Kingdom|British]] | spouse = Jim Doocey | party = [[Liberal Democrats]] | relations = | children = Mark Doocey | residence = | alma_mater = | occupation = | profession = | religion = | signature = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Elizabeth Deirdre ('Dee') Doocey, Baroness Doocey''' [[Order of the British Empire|OBE]] (born 2 May 1948<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/democracylive/hi/representatives/profiles/47236.stm|title=Baroness Doocey|publisher=BBC Democracy|accessdate=26 April 2013}}</ref>), is a [[United Kingdom|British]] [[Liberal Democrats (UK)|Liberal Democrat]] politician and businesswoman, and a former Chair of the [[London Assembly]]. She was born Elizabeth Deirdre O'Keefe in [[Drumcondra, Dublin]]. She married Jim Doocey and they have one son, Mark. During the late 1970s and early 1980s, Dee Doocey was the Director of Finance and Administration at [[Liberal Party (UK)|Liberal Party]] headquarters. She served as a councillor in the [[London Borough of Richmond upon Thames]] from 1986 to 1994, and was chair of the council's Housing Committee. She has been [[election agent]] for [[Vince Cable|Dr Vince Cable]] in her home constituency of [[Twickenham (UK Parliament constituency)|Twickenham]] since 1992. Dee Doocey was a member of the [[London Assembly]] from 2004 to 2012. She originally contested the [[South West (London Assembly constituency)|South West London]] constituency in the [[London Assembly election, 2004|2004 London Assembly elections]], but lost to the [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] incumbent, [[Tony Arbour]], by 4,067 votes. However, as the fifth person on the Liberal Democrat party list, she was elected as a London-wide member of the Assembly. She was re-elected for a second term in [[London Assembly election, 2008|2008]] but did not contest the [[London Assembly election, 2012|2012 election]]. Dee Doocey was Chair of the London Assembly from 2010 to 2011, and Deputy Chair from 2011 to 2012. From 2004 to 2010 and again from 2011 to 2012, she was chair of the Assembly's Economic Development, Culture, Sport & Tourism Committee (renamed the Economy, Culture and Sport Committee in May 2011), which, amongst other responsibilities, scrutinised preparations for the [[2012 Summer Olympics]] and [[2012 Summer Paralympics]] in London. From 2006 to 2012, Dee Doocey was a member of the [[Metropolitan Police Authority]], which oversaw the [[Metropolitan Police]]. She chaired the MPA's Finance & Resources Committee from 2011 to 2012, and also chaired the MPA's Olympic & Paralympic sub-committee. She represented the [[Mayor of London]] on the [[Home Office]] Olympic Security Board from 2008 to 2012. Before her election to the London Assembly, Dee Doocey ran a management consulting business, DD Enterprises. Dee Doocey was created a [[life peer]] on 21 December 2010, as '''Baroness Doocey''', and sits on the [[Liberal Democrats (UK)|Liberal Democrat]] benches in the [[House of Lords]].<ref>{{cite hansard|house=House of Lords|url=http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/ld201011/ldhansrd/text/101222-0001.htm#10122246000550|date = 22 December 2010}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Refbegin}} {{Refend}} ==External links== *[http://www.parliament.uk/biographies/lords/elizabeth-doocey/47236] biography at the site of the House of Lords *[http://www.libdems.org.uk/peers.aspx] biography at the site of the Liberal Democrats {{Current London Assembly members}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Doocey, Dee | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = British politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 2 May 1948 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Drumcondra, Dublin | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Doocey, Dee}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Liberal Democrat (UK) councillors]] [[Category:Liberal Democrat Members of the London Assembly]] [[Category:Councillors in Richmond upon Thames]] [[Category:Liberal Democrat life peers]] [[Category:1948 births]] [[Category:Female life peers]] {{Life-peer-stub}} {{england-politician-stub}}
